backend.src.app.controllers.clients package

Submodules

backend.src.app.controllers.clients.client_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.clients.client_controller.ClientController(client_id, update_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The ClientController class provides methods for managing client data.

This class acts as a controller for validating, updating, deleting, and preparing responses related to a client.

Variables:

  • client_id – The ID of the client.

  • update_data – The data to update for the client.

  • client_service – An instance of the ClientService class for managing client data.

create_response_with_client_data()[source]

Create a response containing all data about the client.

This method uses the client service to retrieve all data about the client and prepares a response.

Returns:

A dictionary containing all data about the client and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, any], int]

create_response_with_successful_delete_message()[source]

Create a response with a successful delete message.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a success message and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

create_response_with_successful_update_message()[source]

Create a response with a successful update message.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a success message and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

delete_client()[source]

Delete the client.

This method uses the client service to delete the client based on their ID.

update_client()[source]

Update the client’s data.

This method uses the client service to update the client’s data. If the update data is invalid, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the client update data is invalid and HTTP status code 400.

validate_client()[source]

Validate the client’s existence.

This method uses the client service to validate the existence of the client based on their ID. If the client does not exist, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the client does not exist and HTTP status code 404.

backend.src.app.controllers.clients.clients_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.clients.clients_controller.ClientsController(client_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The ClientsController class provides methods for handling client-related requests.

This class acts as a controller that uses the ClientsService for creating a new client and preparing data related to all clients.

Variables:

  • client_data – The data for creating a new client.

  • clients_service – An instance of the ClientsService class for managing clients’ data.

create_client()[source]

Create a new client.

This method uses the clients service to create a new client with the provided data. If the client data is invalid, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the client data is invalid with HTTP code 400.

create_response_with_clients_data()[source]

Prepare a response containing data about all clients.

This method uses the clients service to retrieve data about all clients.

Returns:

A tuple where the first item is a list of data about all clients and the second item is the HTTP status code 200.

Return type:

tuple[list[dict[str, any]], int]

create_response_with_successful_create_message()[source]

Prepare a response containing a success message for client creation.

Returns:

A tuple where the first item is a dictionary containing a success message and the second item is the HTTP status code 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

backend.src.app.controllers.clients.clients_sort_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.clients.clients_sort_controller.ClientsSortController(sort_data)[source]

Bases: object

The ClientsSortController class provides methods for sorting clients and creating an appropriate response.

This class acts as a controller for handling requests related to sorting clients.

Variables:

  • sort_data – The data specifying how clients should be sorted.

  • sorted_clients – The sorted client data.

create_response_with_sorted_clients_data()[source]

Create a response containing the sorted client data.

This method prepares a response with the sorted client data. The response includes a 200 status code.

Returns:

The response containing the sorted client data and a 200 status code.

Return type:

tuple[list[dict[str, any]], int]

sort_clients()[source]

Sort client data based on the provided parameters.

This method uses the ClientsSortService to sort all clients based on the sorting data. If the sorting fails, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the sorting fails due to invalid sort QUERY parameters.
